page.title: 09MELSONBY-The Village Sports
page.content: { Village sports day}was begun in{June {1977} as part of the celebrations for the{Silver Jubilee}of{H.M. Queen {Elizabeth II.} It has been held each year since then during mid-July, before the school holidays begin. The afternoon starts with a{fancy {dress parade} and continues with {childrens races} which include{ flat, {obstacle, 3-legged, wheelbarrow, {potatoe, egg & spoon, cross-country {and slow bicycle.} There are{side-shows}such as{ coconut {shy, skittles, roll-a-ball, darts and {catch-a-rat.} Races and competitions for adults are held later in the afternoon and end with the tug-o-war. A tea is provided free for everyone living in the village and the money to pay for this and the prizes is raised from events held during the year.
